content.description:
This is a rather tall boulder with a somewhat relatively flat landing. Climb the small seam that splits the face of this boulder.  

  Start on a low pinch for your right and a pocket for your left.
content.protection: 2 pads. Although the landing is somewhat flat, this is a fairly tall boulder.
content.location: On the outlying edge of The Caves section, this boulder is in close proximity to L'angle. You can't miss it if youre on the Caves Trail.

content.description: Starting on the big jug on the left arete, follow the long arete up the boulder.
content.protection: Several pads. The landing is very precarious. There is even a pointed and jagged rock just waiting to impale someone. Sorry to be so graphic, this one has a terrible landing.

content.description: Just to the left of Sumo Wrestler, climb the slab.
Climb the ball. Start off with fist jams and trend rightward.
content.protection: Several pads. This has a very bad landing.

content.description: Start on the jug on the right arete and follow the obvious line across the 45 degree wall. Reach the crack in the dihedral and continue up to a triangular jug. From here, jump off.
content.protection: 2-3. While the majority of this climb remains somewhat close to the ground, it is somewhat over a pit of jagged rocks. Several ill placed ground boulders create several fall hazards. Pad up and grab some spotters.

content.description: stand start with a side pull for your right and an edge out left right above the chalked up slopey rail. get a high foot and carefully go for one of the crimps up high. top out straight above. a v3 variation exists starting from the slopey rail.
content.location: on the boulder to the left of the one with bouloutian's arete and the balrog.

content.description:
Brace yourself for perhaps the hardest v2 on the mountain. Being able to crimp v-hard will not automatically mean you will be able to power up this arete. Be prepared for a fun challenge deciphering this technical climb.  

  Balance up the left side of the arete.
content.location: Although technically not considered part of The Caves in the guidebook, this is the first climb you happen upon when approaching the Caves from the Top Rock side of the mountain. From here, the Caves are just a stones throw away.

content.description: Start on the right side of the obvious pit. Follow the rail leftward until you reach the large brick sized hold at the base of the sweeping feature. Stab up for the slopers at the lip and mantle over.
content.protection: 2-3 pads and spotters. Although you start near the ground, you trend upwards over a pit with a pretty bad landing. You're making a large dead point move with a large fall potential.

content.location: the arete to the right of Cave Crack.

content.description: Start on jugs at the base of the huge crack. Climb straight up into the scoop on bomber holds.

Its easy to locate this climb. This powerful yet somewhat short line has a really nice landing and is situated in the cave itself. 

  Start with two high fingerlocks in the crack. Using bad foot smears, power up and exit left around the roof.

If sharp crimps are your thing, be sure to give this one a go.  

  Start on the very blunt arete on an obvious two handed crimp seam. Follow a few small crimps to a larger hold and then mantle up over the top.

Start with your left hand on a sloping rail and your right hand on a good crimp sidepull.  Get a high right foot and dyno for the slopey lip, then mantle over.  This problem was originally climbed at V5, using the right hand side pull and a small left hand crimp up high.  The crimp now appears to be broken off, making the dyno significantly longer and more difficult.
content.location: To the left of Bouloutian's ArÃªte

content.description: The Caves offer a nice concentration of some very interesting climbs. Theres a little for everyone in the Caves. From v0 warm ups to v10 face climbs, the range of climbs and their close proximity to each other make the Caves a great destination. This location is similar to Hanger 18 in that it offers a full days worth of climbing in such a small radius.
